page.title: 05KEIGHLEY SCHOOLS IN 1985.
page.content: Children start school at the age of 4 or 5. In this area they will attend a{first school}where the emphasis will be on basic learning and experience. At about 9 years old chidren move upto the{middle school.}In our area they will most likely attend{Bronte {School.}Here pupils will be introduced to a greater variety of school subjects some of which will be taught by specialist teachers. After spending four years at the { {middle school}chilren move at the age of 13 to an{upper school.Oakbank Upper {School}serves our survey area.Pupils enter as 3rd years and take upto 12 subjects.A choice is then made by pupils as to what subjects they are going to take for public exams in the 4th and 5th year.Pupils can leave school at 16 or stay on for 1 or 2 more years to take more exams.
